revised_title: Protein Composition in Rabbit Foetal Fluids
tldr: The study investigates the protein composition of rabbit foetal fluids, including the exocoelomic, amniotic, and allantoic fluids, as well as foetal and maternal sera. The research found that the protein concentration and composition of these fluids change during the 20- to 28-day gestational period. The study also reveals a paucity of lipoproteins and a-1-and a-2-macroglobulins in the foetal fluids, and suggests that the paraplacental chorion is the major site for the passage of proteins to the foetal fluids other than the blood.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
